IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MOFGA IS THE OLDEST AND LARGEST STATE ORGANIC ORGANIZATION IN THE COUNTRY, MOFGA HELPS FARMERS AND GARDENERS GROW AND SELL ORGANIC FOOD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PURPOSE OF THE ASSOCIATION IS TO HELP FARMERS AND GARDENERS GROW ORGANIC FOOD, PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT, RECYCLE NATURAL RESOURCES, INCREASE LOCAL FOOD PRODUCTION, SUPPORT RURAL COMMUNITIES, AND ILLUMINATE FOR CONSUMERS THE CONNECTION BETWEEN HEALTHFUL FOOD AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SOUND GROWING PRACTICES.
IRS990.Desc: AGRICULTURAL FAIR - TO DEMONSTRATE HOW TO PROMOTE TRADITIONAL RURAL PRACTICES THROUGH THE ANNUAL COMMON GROUND COUNTRY FAIR AND ON GOING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS; SERVES APPROXIMATELY 55,000 CLIENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AGRICULTURAL PROGRAM - TO ASSIST FARMERS AND GARDENERS IN ORGANIC METHODS; SERVES APPROXIMATELY 4,500 CLIENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CERTIFICATION PROGRAM - TO CERTIFY PROGRAM FOR ORGANICALLY GROWN LIVESTOCK & PRODUCE. IT PROVIDES AN APPRENTICE PROGRAM TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS IN LEARNING ABOUT ORGANIC FARMING AND GARDENING; APPROXIMATELY 4,500 CLIENTS SERVED.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PUBLICATIONS PROGRAM - PERIODICALS & PUBLICATIONS ARE PRODUCED TO MEMBERS & THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL, NUTRITIONAL, AND RURAL VALUES; APPROXIMATELY 4,500 MEMBERS SERVED WITH PUBLICATION OF MOFGA.
EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS - TO EDUCATE THE GENERAL PUBLIC ON ORGANIC FARMING AND GARDENING METHODS.

MAINE HERITAGE ORCHARD - THE M.H.O IS A 1/2 ACRE ORCHARD LOCATED AT MOFGA'S COMMON GROUND EDUCATION CENTER IN UNITY, MAINE. THE ORCHARD IS COMPRISED ENTIRELY OF APPLE VARITIES THAT ORIGINATED IN MAINE.PUBLIC POLICY AND EL SALVADOR SISTERING - REVIEWS EXISTING AND PROPOSED LEGISLATION AND REGULATIONS THAT ARE RELVANT TO THE PURPOSE OF MOFGA. IT MAY PROPOSE AND SUPPORT LEGISLATIVE AND REGULATORY PROPOSALS AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EL SALVADOR SISTERING PROMOTES SOLIDARITY AMONG SMALL FARMERS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN MAINE AND EL SALVADOR, FOCUSING ON ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL JUSTICE AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH SUSTAINABLE, ORGANIC AGRICULTURE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO SUPPLEMENT INCOME FOR OPERATING EXPENSES. AS OF THE YEAR END DECEMBER 31, 2015, $1,902,314 OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS HAS AN INCOME RESTRICTION TO BE USED FOR THE BEGINNING FARMER FUND.

BUILDIINGS AND GROUNDS - PROVIDES FOR CONSTRUCTION, IMPROVEMENTS, AND MAINTENANCE TO THE GROUNDS AND FACILITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION. MAINE HERITAGE ORCHARD - THE M.H.O IS A 1/2 ACRE ORCHARD LOCATED AT MOFGA'S COMMON GROUND EDUCATION CENTER IN UNITY, MAINE. THE ORCHARD IS COMPRISED ENTIRELY OF APPLE VARITIES THAT ORIGINATED IN MAINE. PUBLIC POLICY AND EL SALVADOR SISTERING - REVIEWS EXISTING AND PROPOSED LEGISLATION AND REGULATIONS THAT ARE RELVANT TO THE PURPOSE OF MOFGA. IT MAY PROPOSE AND SUPPORT LEGISLATIVE AND REGULATORY PROPOSALS AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EL SALVADOR SISTERING PROMOTES SOLIDARITY AMONG SMALL FARMERS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN MAINE AND EL SALVADOR, FOCUSING ON ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL JUSTICE AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH SUSTAINABLE, ORGANIC AGRICULTURE AND SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALICE PERCY, PRESIDENT, IS DAUGHTER OF JIM TORBERT, BOARD MEMBER AND EL SALVADOR STEERING COMMITTEE CHAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEWED BY BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE SIGNING AND FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE DISCLOSED TO THE BOARD AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY IS ROUTINELY MONITORED AND ENFORCED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND/OR A DESIGNATED COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORMS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THE ORGANIZATION UPON REQUEST OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
